channel.title: Chest Requirements
channel.description: Is there a possible way to have the requirement of when you try to open a certain chest it requires 6 different keys? And when you open it with the 6 keys it takes them away?

item.title: Chest Requirements
item.dc:creator: @checkmeup checkmeup
item.description:
@checkmeup wrote:

look like a longer version of this??

} else if (useItemID == 601 && 602 && 603 && atObjectID == 4126) { sendMessage("Well done, you have just finished your mini game, here's your reward :)"); deleteItem(601, getItemSlot(601), 1); deleteItem(602, getItemSlot(602), 1); deleteItem(603, getItemSlot(603), 1); sendMessage("you unlocked the Chest!");

Read full topic

item.title: Chest Requirements
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Here’s an example…

if (Object == ID) { int[] Keys = { 1111, 2222, 3333, 4444, 5555, 6666 }; for (int i = 0; i < Keys.length; i++) { if (Item != Keys[i]) { return; } Int++; Remove(Keys[i], 1); Send("You insert the key into the chest..."); if (Int > 5) { ReplaceObject(ObjectX, ObjectY, NewID, 0); Add(ID, 1); Send("...and you successfully unlock the chest!"); } } }

Read full topic

item.title: Chest Requirements
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

|| in java means OR, and you want it so you can only open it with ALL the keys? By using the ||, you are saying it will work by using item id 601 OR 602 OR 603, which means you only need one.

Try using && instead. This means AND.

Read full topic

item.title: Chest Requirements
item.dc:creator: @_Ryan3 _Ryan
item.description:
@_Ryan3 wrote:

So again try something like this

} else if (useItemID == 601 || 602 || 603 && atObjectID == 4126)
{
                sendMessage("Well done, you have just finished your mini game, here's your reward :)");
                deleteItem(601, getItemSlot(601), 1);
                deleteItem(602, getItemSlot(602), 1);
                deleteItem(603, getItemSlot(603), 1);

Remember to replace those with your keys. Btw I’m not adding the other 3 it should be easy from there.

Read full topic

item.title: Chest Requirements
item.dc:creator: @checkmeup checkmeup
item.description:
@checkmeup wrote:

} else if (useItemID == 601 && atObjectID == 4126) { sendMessage("Well done, you have just finished your mini game, here's your reward :)"); deleteItem(601, getItemSlot(601), 1);

Thats a key on a chest.
I realy dont know how to do multiple things at once…
but thats using 1 key on 1 chest.

to delete the key is easy.
Just do what it says up there, deletItem(601, getItemSlot(601), 1);
The item 601 is the key that you used on the chest in the first part of the code.

Read full topic
